intro: Thlaspi suecicum, commonly known as Swedish carnation, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that are often pink or white in color. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and its ability to thrive in harsh environments. Thlaspi suecicum is often found in alpine and arctic regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
